text: Upon a vote of the Insurance Regulatory Trust Fund Bureau taken in accordance with its bylaws, the Insurance Regulatory Trust Fund Bureau, at its own expense, may annually arrange for an independent audit of the expenditures made in any fiscal year by the Insurance Regulatory Trust Fund. The Commissioner, the Department of Insurance, Securities, and Banking, and all other elements of the Government of the District of Columbia shall cooperate with such an audit and shall make available all documents and records reasonably necessary to the conduct of the audit.
